name: Phosphoricum acidum
Relationship: Compare: OENOTHERA BIENNIS - Evening primrose - (Effortless diarrhoea with nervous exhaustion. Incipient hydrocephaloid. Whooping-cough and spasmodic asthma). NECTRANDA AMARE. (Watery diarrhoea, dry tongue, colic, bluish ring around sunken eyes, restless sleep.) CHINA; NUX; PIC-AC.; LACTIC-AC.; PHOS.Antidotes: COFFEA.

Stool: Diarrhoea, WHITE, watery, involuntary, PAINLESS, with much flatus; not specially exhausting
Diarrhoea in weakly, delicate rachitic children
Micturition, preceded by anxiety and followed by burning
Head: Heavy; CONFUSED
Pain as if temples were crushed together
Worse, SHAKING OR NOISE
CRUSHING HEADACHE
PRESSURE ON TOP
Hair gray early in life; falls out
Dull headache after coition; from eye-strain
VERTIGO TOWARD EVENING, WHEN STANDING OR WALKING
Hair thins out, turns gray early
Fever: PROFUSE SWEAT during night and morning
Low types of fever, with dull comprehension and stupor
Stomach: SYMPTOMS FOLLOWING SOUR FOOD AND DRINK
Pressure as from a weight, with sleepiness after eating
Mouth: Tongue swollen, dry, with viscid, frothy mucus
Respiratory: Dry cough from tickling in chest
WEAK FEELING IN CHEST FROM TALKING
PRESSURE BEHIND THE STERNUM, rendering breathing difficult
Eyes: Averse to sunlight; sees colors as if a rainbow
PAIN AS IF EYEBALLS WERE FORCIBLY PRESSED TOGETHER AND INTO HEAD
Face: Pale, earthy; feeling of tension as from dried albumen
Sensation of coldness of one side of face
Male: Emissions at night and at stool
Sexual power deficient; testicles tender and swollen
Prostatorrhoea, even when passing a soft stool
Oedema of prepuce, and swollen glans-penis
Heart: Palpitation in children, who grow too fast; after grief, self-abuse
Modalities: Worse: from being talked to; loss of vital fluids; sexual excesses
Mind: Cannot collect his thoughts or find the right word
Effects of grief and mental shock
Back: Pain in back and limbs, as if beaten
Female: Menses too early and profuse, with pain in liver
Milk scanty; health deteriorated from nursing
Extremities: Tearing pains in joints, bones, and periosteum
Cramps in upper arms and wrists
Pains at night, AS IF BONES WERE SCRAPED
Itching, between fingers or in folds of joints

details: The common acid "debility" is very marked in this remedy, producing a nervous exhaustion. MENTAL DEBILITY first; later physical. A congenial soil for the action of Phos. acid is found in young people who grow rapidly, and who are overtaxed, mentally or physically. Whenever the system has been exposed to the ravages of acute disease, excesses, grief, loss of vital fluids, we obtain conditions calling for it. Pyrosis, flatulence, diarrhoea, diabetes, rhachitis and periosteal inflammation. Neurosis in stump, after amputation. Hemorrhages in typhoid. Useful in relieving pain of cancer.
